title: Paramount Australian Gazette: an Australian Car for Australian Roads
subject_group: Communications, Infrastructure, & Transport/Automobiles - Design and construction
Agriculture, Business, Commerce & Industry/Automobile industry and trade
Communications, Infrastructure, & Transport/Automobile industry and trade
Agriculture, Business, Commerce & Industry/Automobiles - Industry and trade - Australia
abstract: A silent newsreel item from 1923 showing cars fitted with Summit springs being manufactured and tested at the Summit Motor Works, Sydney, NSW.
description: A brief tour of the newly built Summit Motor Works manufacturing a new automobile capable of weathering the worst Australian roads. We see a snapshot of progress in the local motor industry in Australia - men examining and assembling new chassis and other operations. Women also have a role in the production line, sewing upholstery for new automobiles.
